question: Which two countries share the location of "Cordillera del Condor" mountain range?
explanation: Ecuador and Peru share the location of Cordillera del Condor mountain range. It is a mountain range located in the eastern Andes. This mountain range was the location of 1995 Cenepa War between Ecuador and Peru. According to the Conservation International, this mountain range houses richest flora in any area of the same size on the South American continent and is considered to be one of the most important biodiversity areas on the planet. The Cordillera has one of the highest concentrations of vascular plant species yet unknown to science. This mountain range is part of the ecoregion of the Eastern Cordillera Real Montane Forests.
